channel.title: Clayton Emery's Podcasts - Stories of Mystery, Adventure, and Humor
channel.description: Stories of Mystery and Adventure... and Humor

image.title: Clayton Emery's Podcasts - Stories of Mystery, Adventure, and Humor

item.title: Bring Me the Head of Irongrip Goodfellow!
item.description: Belgar the Barbarian takes on the village's most popular wizard. A funny fantasy tale read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Neighbor Ephraim
item.description: A mountain man finds himself trapped between a starving grizzly and a screaming mother-in-law. Read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 1
item.description: Amid the flames of frontier war, a frail "White Indian" uncovers far worse crimes - murder. Chapter 1. Joseph Fisher, a man of three worlds who belongs to none, uses his wits like a tomahawk. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery, available from Amazon.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 1
item.description: Chapter 1. Starship engineers, husband and wife, are stranded on a forgotten space station. From the novel available at Amazon. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 2
item.description: Chapter 2. Sam and Hannah meet some locals - all armed and dangerous. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 3
item.description: Chapter 3. Vaulting into a crisis, Sam and Hannah get a few answers, but more questions. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 4
item.description: Chapter 4. The immensity and ingenuity of the Jack is impressive, but Sam and Hannah uncover a deadly problem. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 5
item.description: Chapter 5. The Jack's other marvels are the alien races that live alongside humans, but Sam and Hannah fear everyone is doomed. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 6
item.description: Chapter 6. Sam and Hannah explore the fringes of the Jack, and find wonders and dangers aplenty. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 7
item.description: Chapter 7. Before starting critical maintenance, Sam and Hannah must get past local and lethal Jackers. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 8
item.description: Chapter 8. Risking their lives pays off as Sam and Hannah find a map of the Jack. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Jumping the Jack - Chapter 9
item.description: Chapter 9. Shoving burned bones aside, Sam and Hannah find some answers - and bigger problems. Science fiction read by Earl Wajenberg.

item.title: Totaled
item.description: Tyger Blake wants to know, What's up with this car? An Edgar-Nominated PI mystery by Clayton Emery, read by Susan Therriault.

item.title: Flushing Scarlett
item.description: Pursued by soldiers and guards, Robin Hood's crazy cousins tear through pigsties, prostitutes, pratfalls and purses. From Mandrake and Murder: The Robin and Marian Mysteries at Amazon. Read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Floating Bread and Quicksilver
item.description: Robin and Marian follow seagulls and bread to find a drowned fisherman. From Mandrake and Murder: The Robin and Marian Mysteries available at Amazon. Read by Susan Therriault.

item.title: Every Man a King
item.description: British-American soldiers on a suicide mission at the Battle of New Orleans. Read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Flyting, Fighting
item.description: Robin and Marian fight each other as much as the enemy! From Mandrake and Murder: The Robin and Marian Mysteries at Amazon. Read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Python Peril!
item.description: "Try not to get strangled." A true funny story from zookeeper days read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: The Thing in the Furnace
item.description: Rule #1: Never go in your cellar. A funny science fiction tale read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 2
item.description: Chapter 2. Arriving in Hull, Joseph Fisher wonders how a sailor could wash ashore after four years missing. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 3
item.description: Chapter 3. The village prepares badly for war, Anne comes calling, and Joseph runs afoul of the puritanical parson. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 4
item.description: Chapter 4. Joseph tries to settle in, but his agile mind and quick tongue are a blessing and a curse, while Paul suffers good and bad news. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 5
item.description: Chapter 5. Fresh news means more mystery as Joseph Fisher befriends Indians and Negroes, and sinks lower in the village's estimation. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 6
item.description: Chapter 6. While the village prepares - or doesn't - for Indian raids, Joseph is handed the mystery of Ruth's "bad seed" that denies her marriage to Paul. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 7
item.description: Chapter 7. Joseph forgets mysteries for the moment as French and Indians raiders sweep through Hull, burning, killing, and kidnapping. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 8
item.description: Chapter 8. Joseph can only watch and despair as the French and Indian raid on Hull rages all around. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 9
item.description: Chapter 9. In the aftermath of the French and Indian raid, the villagers pick up bodies, and Joseph finds mysteries a'plenty.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 10
item.description: Chapter 10. In the aftermath of the French and Indian raid, Joseph identifies victims who suffered worse than war - murder.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 11
item.description: Chapter 11. The men of Hull pursue the French and Indian raiders into the forest, but Joseph fears disaster. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 12
item.description: Chapter 12. The English pursuers stumble into disaster in the wilderness, and Joseph makes a fateful decision.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 13
item.description: Chapter 13. Joseph forges into No Man's Land in search of answers, and finds homesickness and horrors. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 14
item.description: Chapter 14. Risking his life, Joseph confronts the raiders with questions and pleas. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 15
item.description: Chapter 15. Trying to avert tragedy, Joseph is damned to Hell and condemned as a traitor. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 16
item.description: Chapter 16. Back in Hull, the villagers pick up their shattered lives, and Joseph picks up his investigations. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 17
item.description: Chapter 17. Sailing to Boston, Joseph prods reluctant relatives for the true story of Ruth's birth. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 18
item.description: Chapter 18. In Puritan Boston, Joseph digs for Ruth's origins and uncovers injustice. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 19
item.description: Chapter 19. Another death rattles Hull, and the grieving villagers turn on Joseph. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 20
item.description: Chapter 20. Joseph pursues a dead sailor's ghost - and uncovers a conspiracy. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 21
item.description: Chapter 21. Joseph explains the murderer's scheme, and the queer help he received in solving it. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery.

item.title: Pale Ghost - Chapter 22
item.description: Chapter 22. In the final chapter, Joseph Fisher ties up loose ends and makes a fateful decision. A colonial mystery read by Clayton Emery, available from Amazon.
